item.title: 2026 is the year that Britain turns a corner and people here in West Lancashire start to feel better off. My latest col...
item.description: 2026 is the year that Britain turns a corner and people here in West Lancashire start to feel better off. My latest column in the Ormskirk Advertiser is out today. In it, I reflect upon 2025 and just some of what is to come for us this year.

item.title: As the Minister for Public Health and Prevention, I've been responsible for driving through the National Cancer Plan....
item.description: As the Minister for Public Health and Prevention, I’ve been responsible for driving through the National Cancer Plan. We’re putting patients at the very heart of our cancer plan, led by a cancer patient at the head. Source: Ashley Dalton MP (Bluesky)

item.title: Everyone who has been impacted by cancer will know how it affects every aspect of your life. Thatâ€™s why this plan focu...
item.description: Everyone who has been impacted by cancer will know how it affects every aspect of your life. Thatâ€™s why this plan focuses on early diagnosis, swifter treatments and clinical trials â€“ all underpinned by a revolution in cancer science and technology.

item.title: How are Labour supporting children in West Lancashire? Through our Plan for Change, we'll put money in parents' pockets...
item.description: How are Labour supporting children in West Lancashire? Through our Plan for Change, we’ll put money in parents’ pockets and give children the best start in life. Source: Ashley Dalton MP (Bluesky)

item.title: Last night, I voted to remove the 2 child limit and lift 450,000 children out of poverty. Here in West Lancashire, 2140...
item.description: Last night, I voted to remove the 2 child limit and lift 450,000 children out of poverty. Here in West Lancashire, 2140 children will benefit from the 2-child limit being scrapped. Thatâ€™s over 2000 children whose chances in life will be better off as a result of this Labour government.
